intro: Chrysanthemum carinatum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow or orange ray florets and a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance. Chrysanthemum carinatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
